Package thirdparty.dlib.optimization

Class LBFGSSearchStrategy

java.lang.Object
thirdparty.dlib.optimization.LBFGSSearchStrategy
public class LBFGSSearchStrategy extends Object
adapted from dlib class optimization/optimization_search_strategies.h Limited-memory BFGS is an optimization algorithm in the family of quasi-Newton methods (finds zeroes or local maxima and minima of functions) that approximates the Broyden–Fletcher–Goldfarb–Shanno (BFGS) algorithm using a limited amount of computer memory. It is a popular algorithm for parameter estimation in machine learning (add license here) WHAT THIS OBJECT REPRESENTS This object represents a strategy for determining which direction a line search should be carried out along. This particular object is an implementation of the L-BFGS quasi-newton method for determining this direction. This method uses an amount of memory that is linear in the number of variables to be optimized. This makes it an excellent method to use when an optimization problem has a large number of variables.

  • Constructor Details

    • LBFGSSearchStrategy

      public LBFGSSearchStrategy(int maxSize)
      Parameters:
      maxSize - L-BFGS works by remembering a certain number of position and gradient pairs. It uses this remembered information to compute search directions. The max_size argument determines how many of these pairs will be remembered. Typically, using between 3 and 30 pairs performs well for many problems.

      public double get_wolfe_rho()
      for use of Wolfe conditions to constrain step length during line search. Wolfe conditions are valuable in Newton methods, while Goldstein conditions are valuable in quasi-Newton methods.
